snippet: They gained control over a major jihadist supply line as part of a broader offensive to reclaim the town of Sinjar. The Times has two reporters on the front lines.
abstract: Kurdish forces and Yazidi fighters begin offensive against Islamic State militants in northern Iraq, taking back strategic main highway jihadists used as supply line, and advance toward town of Sinjar; forces are bolstered by heavy American airstrikes against ISIS.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: They gained control over a major jihadist supply line as part of a broader offensive to reclaim the town of Sinjar. The Times has two reporters on the front lines.

headline.main: Kurds Retake Strategic Highway in Iraq’s North From ISIS
headline.print_headline: Kurds Take Back Strategic Road in Iraq From ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
